intro: Erigeron baumii, commonly known as the Blueweed or Bluecup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erigeron baumii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
